intro: Verbascum assurense var. assurense, commonly known as the Armenian mullein, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia and Turkey. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its medicinal properties, with historical use in treating respiratory ailments. Its fibrous leaves and stems have also been used in traditional crafts and textiles.
